alert.note: Alert for Dearborn (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:31PM EDT until March 26 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...In Southeast Indiana, Dearborn, Ohio and Ripley Counties. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1030 PM EDT, emergency management reported flooding along State Route 62 from Laughery Creek near Friendship. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the last 24 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible overnight. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Versailles, French, Hartford, Friendship, Olean and Versailles Lake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
